intro: Canthiumera neilgherrensis, commonly known as the Nilgiri canthium, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
